question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Let $a,$ $b,$ $c$ be complex numbers satisfying
\begin{align*}
(a + 1)(b + 1)(c + 1) &= 1, \\
(a + 2)(b + 2)(c + 2) &= 2, \\
(a + 3)(b + 3)(c + 3) &= 3.
\end{align*}Find $(a + 4)(b + 4)(c + 4).$
inference:
Expanding the equations, we get
\begin{align*}
abc + ab + ac + bc + a + b + c + 1 &= 1, \\
abc + 2ab + 2ac + 2bc + 4a + 4b + 4c + 8 &= 2, \\
abc + 3ab + 3ac + 3bc + 9a + 9b + 9c + 27 &= 3.
\end{align*}Subtracting the first equation from the second, we get
\[ab + ac + bc + 3a + 3b + 3c + 7 = 1.\]Subtracting the second equation from the third, we get
\[ab + ac + bc + 5a + 5b + 5c + 19 = 1.\]Subtracting these last two equations, we get
\[2a + 2b + 2c + 12 = 0,\]so $a + b + c = -6.$

Then
\begin{align*}
(a + 4)(b + 4)(c + 4) &= abc + 4(ab + ac + bc) + 16(a + b + c) + 64 \\
&= abc + 4(ab + ac + bc) - 96 + 64 \\
&= abc + 4(ab + ac + bc) - 32.
\end{align*}From the equation $abc + ab + ac + bc + a + b + c + 1 = 1,$ $abc + ab + ac + bc = -a - b - c = 6,$ so
\[(a + 4)(b + 4)(c + 4) = 6 - 32 = \boxed{-26}.\]
ground_truth:
Let $p(x) = (a + x)(b + x)(c + x),$ which is a monic, third-degree polynomial in $x.$  Let $q(x) = p(x) - x,$ so $q(1) = q(2) = q(3) = 0.$  Also, $q(x)$ is cubic and monic, so
\[q(x) = (x - 1)(x - 2)(x - 3).\]Hence, $p(x) = (x - 1)(x - 2)(x - 3) + x.$  In particular, $p(4) = (3)(2)(1) + 4 = \boxed{10}.$

inference:

ground_truth:
Let $p(x) = (a + x)(b + x)(c + x),$ which is a monic, third-degree polynomial in $x.$  Let $q(x) = p(x) - x,$ so $q(1) = q(2) = q(3) = 0.$  Also, $q(x)$ is cubic and monic, so
\[q(x) = (x - 1)(x - 2)(x - 3).\]Hence, $p(x) = (x - 1)(x - 2)(x - 3) + x.$  In particular, $p(4) = (3)(2)(1) + 4 = \boxed{10}.$
